name: UpdateContactInformation
description:
Update information for an existing contact.

Use this tool to update the details of an existing omni-channel contact in a specified audience in Mailchimp. Ideal for modifying contact information such as email, name, or other personal details.

parameters.name: audience_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the audience to be updated.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the audience.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the contact to be updated.

value_schema.description: The unique id for the contact.

parameters.name: contact_details
parameters.description: The JSON object containing details to update, such as language, email, SMS, merge fields, and tags for the contact. Include appropriate consent statuses and sources.

name.description: The name of the entity's source

source.description: The source from which the parent's entity was created from.

marketing_consent.description: A contact's current consent status for email marketing communications. See the [Audiences (BETA) documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/audiences-introduction) to learn about supported values.

name.description: The name of the entity's source

source.description: The source from which the parent's entity was created from.

marketing_consent.description: A contact's current consent status for SMS marketing communications. See the [Audiences (BETA) documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/audiences-introduction) to learn about supported values.

merge_fields.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the [Merge Fields documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for more about the structure.

tags.description: An array of tag names to add to the contact. This operation is append-only; existing tags will be preserved, and only new tags from this array will be added.

parameters.name: merge_field_validation_mode
parameters.description: Specifies how merge field validation is handled. Options: `ignore_required_checks` (no error if fields missing), `strict` (errors if required fields not provided). Default is `strict`.

value_schema.description: Defines how merge field validation is handled. When set to `ignore_required_checks`, the API does not raise an error if required merge fields are missing from the request. When set to `strict`, the API enforces validation and returns an error if any required merge field is not provided. If this setting is omitted, `strict` is applied by default.

parameters.name: data_processing_mode
parameters.description: Specify `historical` to prevent triggering automations/webhooks, or `live` to trigger them for contact data changes.

value_schema.description: Indicates the data processing mode. In `historical` mode, contact data changes do not trigger automations or webhooks. In `live mode`, such changes do trigger them.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

When set to `strict`, the API enforces validation and returns an error if any required merge field is not provided. If this setting is omitted, `strict` is applied by default.

When set to `strict`, the API enforces validation and returns an error if any required merge field is not provided. If this setting is omitted, `strict` is applied by default.

value_schema.description: Indicates the data processing mode. In `historical` mode, contact data changes do not trigger automations or webhooks. In `live mode`, such changes do trigger them.
